external_links.text: Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements (PDF)
external_links.context: The Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Grade Requirements and the Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements (PDF) are also incorporated by reference into the SFCR but are prepared by third parties, the Fruit and Vegetable Dispute Resolution Corporation and the Canadian Beef Grading Agency, respectively.

external_links.text: Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements (PDF)
external_links.context: the food meets health and safety requirements [308(1)(a), SFCR] the food meets the grade requirements, including colour class requirements, if any, as set out in the Canadian Grade Compendium , the Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Grade Requirements or the Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements (PDF) [308(1)(b), SFCR] the food meets applicable standards of identity and composition requirements, as set out in the Canadian Standards of Identity document, if any [308(1)(c), SFCR] the food is packaged and labelled in accordance with the regulatory requirements [308(1)(f), SFCR], and the food is generally graded by a licence holder or by a grader [308(1)(d) and (e), SFCR]

external_links.text: Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements (PDF)
external_links.context: A grade name that is applied to a beef carcass, bison carcass, ovine carcass, veal carcass, poultry carcass that is dressed or partially dressed, dairy product or egg must be shown as illustrated in the Compendium or the Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements (PDF) [313, SFCR].
